meanings.definition: Unwillingness to give or spend money; miserliness.
meanings.sent1: Her stinginess with money made it hard for her to enjoy simple pleasures.
meanings.sent2: His stinginess was evident when he refused to contribute even a small amount to the charity.
meanings.sent3: The family joked about Uncle Bob's stinginess, saying he'd rather swim in a pool of coins than spend a penny.
meanings.sent4: The stinginess of the old mansion's owner was reflected in the dusty, neglected rooms.
meanings.sent5: The stinginess of the landlord became apparent when he refused to fix the leaking roof, causing damage to the tenants' belongings.

meanings.definition: The quality of being unwilling to give or spend money; miserliness.
meanings.sent1: The stinginess of the company's budgeting led to layoffs and reduced employee benefits.
meanings.sent2: We were surprised by the stinginess of the restaurant owner, who charged extra for every little request.
meanings.sent3: The stinginess of the baker with frosting on the cupcakes made them look more like muffins.
meanings.sent4: The stinginess of the town council in maintaining the park resulted in overgrown grass and broken benches.
meanings.sent5: The stinginess of the CEO became evident when he cut employee bonuses despite record profits.
